abstract: More companies are offering concierge services as perks to their employees, who may be too busy at work for tasks like arranging for a plumber or booking a vacation.
snippet: More companies are offering concierge services as perks to their employees, who may be too busy at work for tasks like arranging for a plumber or booking a vacation.
lead_paragraph: WHEN Jonathan Swanson, a warehouse associate at Mercedes-Benz USA, was planning his honeymoon, he didn’t log on to a travel Web site or start a Google search. Instead, he picked up the phone and called Circles, a 24-hour personal concierge service that is a free benefit available to Mercedes-Benz USA employees.

headline.main: My Personal To-Do List? The Concierge Has It
headline.print_headline: My Personal To-Do List? The Concierge Has It
